1.text: For this cause I Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus in behalf of you Gentiles,â€”

2.text: if so be that ye have heard of the dispensation of that grace of God which was given me to you-ward;

3.text: how that by revelation was made known unto me the mystery, as I wrote before in few words,

4.text: whereby, when ye read, ye can perceive my understanding in the mystery of Christ;

5.text: which in other generations was not made known unto the sons of men, as it hath now been revealed unto his holy apostles and prophets in the Spirit;

6.text: to wit, that the Gentiles are fellow-heirs, and fellow-members of the body, and fellow-partakers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the gospel,

7.text: whereof I was made a minister, according to the gift of that grace of God which was given me according to the working of his power.

8.text: Unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, was this grace given, to preach unto the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;

9.text: and to make all men see what is the dispensation of the mystery which for ages hath been hid in God who created all things;

10.text: to the intent that now unto the principalities and the powers in the heavenly places might be made known through the church the manifold wisdom of God,

11.text: according to the eternal purpose which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:

12.text: in whom we have boldness and access in confidence through our faith in him.

13.text: Wherefore I ask that ye may not faint at my tribulations for you, which are your glory.

14.text: For this cause I bow my knees unto the Father,

15.text: from whom every family in heaven and on earth is named,

16.text: that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, that ye may be strengthened with power through his Spirit in the inward man;

17.text: that Christ may dwell in your hearts through faith; to the end that ye, being rooted and grounded in love,

18.text: may be strong to apprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth,

19.text: and to know the love of Christ which passeth knowledge, that ye may be filled unto all the fulness of God.

20.text: Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think, according to the power that worketh in us,

21.text: unto him be the glory in the church and in Christ Jesus unto all generations for ever and ever. Amen.
